motifmatchr

    motifmatchr

    Vignette Author

    2017-01-18

    Finding motif matches

    The match_pwms takes as inputs these motifs, or your own list of motifs, and returns a (Ranged)SummarizedExperiment with a matrix indicating what peaks (rows) contain what motifs (columns).

    library(motifmatchr)
library(GenomicRanges)
library(IRanges)

data(example_motifs, package = "motifmatchr")
peaks <- GRanges(seqnames = c("chr1","chr2","chr2"),
                 ranges = IRanges(start = c(76585873,42772928,100183786),
                                  width = 500))

# get motif matches
motif_ix <- match_pwms(example_motifs, peaks)

    match_pwms can accept as the second argument either a RangedSummarizedExperiment, GenomicRanges, DNAStringSet, or character vector. If the argument is not a sequence object, then a genome argument is also required, which should be a BSgenome object – the default is BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19.
